definition[0]: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc
example[0]: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
example[1]: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
definition[1]: the basic systems and structures that a country needs to make economic activity possible, for example transport, communications, and power supplies
example[2]: Work is urgently needed to repair our decaying infrastructure.
example[3]: The government invested $65 billion in infrastructure.
definition[2]: the basic systems and equipment needed for an industry or business to operate successfully
example[4]: No retail infrastructure exists to channel these new products to the customers.
definition[3]: the computers, communications networks, and software needed for computer systems to operate or to communicate with other systems
example[5]: On-line services are a major part of the Internet infrastructure.
